channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: DOGE released data about federal contract savings. It doesn't add up
item.description: A new government tracker claims DOGE has saved billions from ending federal contracts. But an NPR analysis of the data finds the claimed savings don't add up.
item.content:encoded:
A new government tracker claims DOGE has saved billions from ending federal contracts. But an NPR analysis of the data finds the claimed savings don't add up.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Trump administration yanks CDC flu vaccine campaign
item.description: As flu rages, the Trump administration has pulled the plug on a Centers for Disease Control and Prevention flu immunization campaign that targeted high-risk groups, including pregnant women.
item.content:encoded: As flu rages, the Trump administration has pulled the plug on a Centers for Disease Control and Prevention flu immunization campaign that targeted high-risk groups, including pregnant women.
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: Judge deliberates after Justice Department pushes to end corruption case against NYC Mayor Adams
item.description: During a hearing on Wednesday, Judge Dale Ho questioned federal prosecutors over their decision to suspend criminal charges against Mayor Eric Adams. Judge Ho's ruling is expected soon.
item.content:encoded:
During a hearing on Wednesday, Judge Dale Ho questioned federal prosecutors over their decision to suspend criminal charges against Mayor Eric Adams. Judge Ho's ruling is expected soon.

(Image credit: Yuki Iwamura)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: GOP senators fact check Trump's Ukraine rhetoric, while still backing his strategy
item.description: Lawmakers sought to dispel Kremlin talking points echoed by the president that Ukraine was responsible for the war with Russia. But they said Trump should be given room to negotiate.
item.content:encoded:
Lawmakers sought to dispel Kremlin talking points echoed by the president that Ukraine was responsible for the war with Russia. But they said Trump should be given room to negotiate.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Susan Davis

item.title: Seven Chilean men are charged with stealing millions from high-profile athletes' homes
item.description: Seven Chilean men face federal charges related to a string of burglaries at the homes of six high-profile athletes. NFL quarterbacks Pat Mahomes and Joe Burrows were among the targets.
item.content:encoded:
Seven Chilean men face federal charges related to a string of burglaries at the homes of six high-profile athletes. NFL quarterbacks Pat Mahomes and Joe Burrows were among the targets.

(Image credit: Justice Department)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: In potential showdown, aid groups demand court find USAID, State officials in contempt
item.description: Aid groups are urging a federal judge to find Trump administration officials in contempt to force them to reopen funding to global programs. USAID says it has a legal right to cancel aid contracts.
item.content:encoded:
Aid groups are urging a federal judge to find Trump administration officials in contempt to force them to reopen funding to global programs. USAID says it has a legal right to cancel aid contracts.

(Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Europe's Biggest Economy is in Trouble
item.description: Germany's economy boomed as the world underwent globalization. But since then, too little investment, too much bureaucracy and a nearby war in Ukraine has cause Europe's largest economy to stagnate. The issue has played a big role in the upcoming German election. Our Berlin correspondent tells takes us to a German factory.
item.content:encoded: Germany's economy boomed as the world underwent globalization. But since then, too little investment, too much bureaucracy and a nearby war in Ukraine has cause Europe's largest economy to stagnate. The issue has played a big role in the upcoming German election. Our Berlin correspondent tells takes us to a German factory.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Hurricane, the hero Belgian Malinois who protected the Obama White House from intruder, has died
item.description: Hurricane, who was a Special Operations Canine for the Secret Service, became the most decorated dog in U.S. history. He died this week at the age of 16.
item.content:encoded:
Hurricane, who was a Special Operations Canine for the Secret Service, became the most decorated dog in U.S. history. He died this week at the age of 16.

(Image credit: Peter Summers/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Manuela López Restrepo

item.title: Hockey Hall of Famer Bobby Hull died with CTE, researchers say
item.description: Bobby Hull, an electric left-winger known as the 'Golden Jet', marveled hockey fans for his will to win. Named one of the NHL's greatest players, Hull was found to have had CTE after his death.
item.content:encoded:
Bobby Hull, an electric left-winger known as the 'Golden Jet', marveled hockey fans for his will to win. Named one of the NHL's greatest players, Hull was found to have had CTE after his death.

(Image credit: Amr Alfiky)
item.dc:creator: Russell Lewis

item.title: Men die younger than women. Is it time for a focus on men's health?
item.description: Researchers would like to see more study on how stress, the economy and attitudes toward medicine influence the well-being and longevity of men.
item.content:encoded:
Researchers would like to see more study on how stress, the economy and attitudes toward medicine influence the well-being and longevity of men.

(Image credit: Ashley Milne-Tyte for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Milne-Tyte
